item.title: These five popular stocks face serious regulatory risks. Here’s what could go wrong.

review.headline_rewrite: These five popular stocks face serious regulatory risks. Here’s what could go wrong.
bullets: Some companies discussed below operate almost as duopoly businesses with high degree of visibility on revenue and profit.
But in India, companies operating in duopoly industries are also subject to a lot of government control and have a compliance burden to ensure
As a result, sectors and companies that may once have flourished under lenient or ambiguous rules now find themselves exposed to sudden, sweeping regulatory
In recent years the Indian government and regulators such as Sebi, RBI and Trai have become far more proactive, sometimes even aggressive, in plugging

item.title: Upcoming IPO: Omnitech Engineering receives SEBI nod to launch public issue worth  ₹850 crore

review.headline_rewrite: Upcoming IPO: Omnitech Engineering receives SEBI nod to launch public issue worth  ₹850 crore
bullets: Upcoming IPO: Omnitech Engineering, on Tuesday, received markets regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) approval to launch IPO worth ₹850 crore.
The IPO comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth up to ₹520 crore and an offer for sale of shares valued at ₹330
The company also plans to raise ₹104 crore through a pre-IPO placement.
The shares of the company is proposed to be listed on both National Stock Exchange (NSE) and Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

item.title: One-third of FY25 renewable bids come with storage

review.headline_rewrite: One-third of FY25 renewable bids come with storage
bullets: CareEdge Ratings points out that the power sector is undergoing a significant transformation, with renewable energy (RE) poised to drive future capacity additions.
Consequently, the share of non-fossil sources in total energy generation is expected to rise to over 35 per cent by FY30, compared to 25

“Energy storage is emerging as a key enabler for India’s renewable transition, with RE + storage tenders accounting for nearly 35 per cent of

item.title: Suzlon's S144 wind turbines record lowest carbon footprint

review.headline_rewrite: Suzlon's S144 wind turbines record lowest carbon footprint
bullets: + 314.49 + 104.15 + 27.00 + 198.00 + 165.00 Renewable energy solutions provider Suzlon on Tuesday said its 'Made in India' wind turbine
Suzlon has redesigned the turbine to cut steel use by 2.5 times, incorporating recycled steel and scrap, while sourcing 83.25 per cent of components
